subject: Re: [junit] JUnitBenchmarks (application of @Rule)
msgSnippet: I filed a feature request here: http://github.com/KentBeck/junit/issues/issue/92 Dawid
messageBody:
I filed a feature request here:
http://github.com/KentBeck/junit/issues/issue/92

Dawid

On Mon, Mar 8, 2010 at 4:02 PM, David Saff <david@...> wrote:
> That does sound useful.  Can you log a feature request so we don't forget it?
>
>   David
>
> On Mon, Mar 8, 2010 at 9:47 AM, Dawid Weiss
> <Dawid.Weiss@...> wrote:
>> I agree, it is quite cool. We have found JUnit tests to be extremely
>> helpful in micro-benchmarks. Basically, all the infrastructure is out
>> there, you can run micro-benchmarks from within Eclipse or any other
>> IDE, draw charts immediately... very helpful.
>>
>> One thing we did have a problem with was to attach a listener to the
>> build runner from within Rule's implementation. It seems to me it's
>> basically impossible at the moment. Perhaps it's a bad smell in
>> design, but capturing end-of-all-tests event would be very helpful for
>> applications like this one (to generate summaries, charts, etc.). For
>> now, we use a workaround of capturing JVM shutdown... works well in
>> most scenarios, but is dirty, brr.
>>
>> Dawid
>>
>> On Mon, Mar 8, 2010 at 3:30 PM, David Saff <david@...> wrote:
>>> Dawid,
>>>
>>> This is really cool.  Thank you!
>>>
>>>   David Saff
>>>
>>> On Mon, Mar 8, 2010 at 6:33 AM, dawid_weiss
>>> <Dawid.Weiss@...> wrote:
>>>> Hi there!
>>>>
>>>> I hope this will be interesting to folks listening on this mailing list. We have recently written a simple benchmarking suite on top of JUnit. Benchmarks are basically a custom @Rule added to your tests, so can be easily tuned, enabled/ disabled, etc. We found this package so useful that we decided to share it under Apache2 license. More information about the library here:
>>>>
>>>> http://labs.carrotsearch.com/junit-benchmarks.html
>>>>
>>>> Thanks for your hard work on improving JUnit,
>>>>
>>>> Dawid
